description: Etobicoke is a relaxed area along the Humber River. It's saturated with green spaces and conservatories, making it a premier destination for outdoor sports, hiking, and nature walks. Its abundance of parkland and lakes makes it a typical spot for fishing, picnicking, and camping out, especially in warmer months. The peaceful area is also enjoyed by families, who appreciate its boardwalks and sports facilities. Locals enjoy the variety of golfing and country club opportunities, which also provide lessons for golfers of any skill level.

reviews.title: Skip This Place
text: Tiny run down track.  Worn out and dirty arcade area.  Mini golf was just okay.  The two female “staff” working on Saturday could not be bothered to look up from their phones long enough to acknowledge the customers standing in line.  The tortoise Albert on display had more personality that the two chicks working at the ticket counter.  Suggest skip this place.

reviews.title: Good experience overall
text: We bought this from Groupon at $30. It includes 10 laps of Go Karts and 18 holes of glow in the dark golf. When we got there we had to create and account on the tablets along the counter and sign the waiver. This took time because the one tablet was sticking and I had to do it 3 times. The tablet on the very left works but the one beside it was giving a problem. However the employee who works there was very friendly and talked us through it. We then went out and picked out our helmets. Take off your glasses first (if you wear them) before putting on a helmet. The older gentleman told us about the rules and gave us our cars. The go karts had to be the smoothest go karts I’ve ever been on and the breaks worked very well. Just like a car. When we reached 9 laps the gentleman came out and waved a flag to let us know. There is also a junior go kart track for the little guys. After the go karts we went and got our golf clubs, balls and score card with pencil. I loved the glow in the dark and the race car theme. The course was fun. If you want to play another game then you hand in the card and get the next game for $7 each. We spent about 1 hour and a half here. We went on a Wednesday around 12:15 and there was only 2 other people ahead of us. It made for an enjoyable time not having anyone around. You get a membership card that’s good for 2 years. And it gets you $$ off your next visit. Also cannonball war games where you play in 2 teams and shoot balls into the other teams net and whoever gets the most balls wins. On Stoffel Drive make sure you go to the end of the road and turn right. The front of the building faces the highway. Lots of parking. This was a fun experience.

reviews.title: Not recommended
text: I confirmed my reservation 2 months in advance only to find out the week prior to the party that my reservation was cancelled and the spot was given to someone else. The supervisor stated they changed their policy and required a deposit to which I most definitely was not informed. I just had another party there 4 months ago so why would I assume the policy changed? I was still able to take the kids for the go carting alone and charged the party price deal.

However, they charged me one extra person; didn’t get the bday boy trophy which is included in the deal; was delayed by 45 mins due to a backlog of registrations; didn’t get their membership cards for next time; and had to text all the parents to pick up their kids one hour later due to the delays. I will not recommend this venue to anyone. Will be taking my business elsewhere where good customer service is valued.

reviews.title: Avoid this place! Not worth time or money!
text: The parking area has scrap all over that would puncture your tires, and when you drive around for more parking.. it's muddy and filled with garbage.
The service desk couldn't put on a smile if their life depended on it.. it seems no one wants to be there.
It's very expensive for what it is.
Once you get out to the raving prep area there's helmets thrown everywhere, no one cares to organize it.

The racing pit - no one there's cares to make any eye contact, say hello or for that matter anything at all. There are signs that read "No bumping" - but absolutely no rules were reinforced. Karts are bumped left right and centre. Woke up in pain the next morning from 'bumper karts'.
No one here cares about your experience or your safety!

reviews.title: a lot of fun
text: been now 3 times with a group of young teen boys. Mini golf, co karting and this other teniis ball shooting game. They love it and I have fun also. Somecarts are quicker than others. Watch the race before and decide what car to avoid!

reviews.title: Very friendly for beginners to advance drivers
text: Was my first time on a go kart and I really enjoy every minute I was in the go kart after going around the track a few times my family then move to the mini golf. It was my step son birthday so me,my husband and daughter loved it just as my stepson.

reviews.title: We Had Fun!
text: Groupon purchase is definitely the best way to enjoy this venue, as the mimi putt is included. Nothing special about this tired place, but we had a good time and a handful of hole in ones! The karting is not very organized with the family and 'experienced' groups being separated without signage. The track is smallish and passing is difficult unless the driver in front makes a poor driving line. Gas engines make for a smelly experience. The experience took way longer than expected, so make time. Don't think I'll need to return, but our family had a good time.

reviews.title: Groupon Deal a little Dingy here
text: The building is a little worn.  The cars are a bit worn too.  The cars are gas, so you kind of smell afterwards.  The helmets are a little worn too.  Some of the helmets have strap buckles missing on them.  The seat belts got caught a lot and a bit difficult to buckle up.
The staff are nice, except one - grumpy old guy at the track.  I think that the number of laps given was fine.
Mini golf afterwards was fine too.  I didn't find any places to eat here.  Washrooms were clean.
We went on a Groupon deal.  I am not sure if I would go again

reviews.title: Mini Golf experience
text: 401 mini-indy also has a mini golf area which is glow in the dark, this was fun the building and min golf is a bit worn with some tape holding tbings together, but i guess it adds to the charm

reviews.title: Jr Go-Kart
text: The kids had a lot of fun with the junior go-kart.  Make sure you wear gloves, as the track is indoors but not heated.

reviews.title: 401 Mini Indy
text: We went to 401 Mini Indy on a very cold day in February. It was fairly easy to find the location, upon arriving it looks a little run down in a very large grey warehouse. There is not really any signage indicating which way to go but we walked in (apparently from the back entrance) and had to walk to the front alongside the go kart track to get to the front to buy tickets for go karting. Initially there was a 45 minute wait for the go karts so we went mini golfing which was housed at the same location. We had fun doing a quick put through the glow in the dark scenery. The location was extremely filled with children so if your looking for a peaceful mini putting experience this may not be for you. Anyways the wait for go karting was very long and filled with fumes and cold air. Make sure to dress warm and if you are asthmatic then forget this! go on a warmer day so they have the doors open and its better ventilated because otherwise your lungs will be fried for days!

reviews.title: A Day at the Track
text: Located in less than the nicest part of town. At first glance a little run down, BUT if you wanna have fun this is a great spot. We went as a group of threee (we're in our 50's) and were there for the Pro-Karts (which you must have a drivers license to ride). The course is rather short but the Karts are pretty fast. After just 10 laps my arms were ready to fall off but we kept going for another 5. I don't think I would go for more than 15 laps without a break.
Go in sping or fall would be best as I would assume that in the summer it would be quite warm and in winter the place would be closed up and the fumes would be a little over-powering.
After Go-Karts we did the Glow-in-the-Dark MiniPutt (18 holes). We got a deal off of Wagjag so it was fairly inexpensive and was a lot of fun. The staff were young, helpful and friendly.

reviews.title: Disorganized
text: Extremely low customer service and organization. I doubt if the place has even a license. We haven't seen such disorganized places in years. They charge huge prices for tickets, and trey don't even care what experience customers get. Our children stayed in line for over two hours, while employees who supposed to serve the line allowed others to go ahead of them. Until we requested management to help us understand what was going on. Don't ruin your day. Stay away from this place. There plenty other places where you can get much better experience. Certainly not family friendly not children friendly place.

reviews.title: Vroom Vroom!
text: This facility has indoor, gas powered go karts, and Glow in the dark Mini golf.

For the Karting, there are slower junior karts for children and youth up to 16 years old (adults can choose this if they wish), and faster Pro karts for those with driver's license or 19 and older with ID.

The Mini-golf is glow in the dark, 18 par 2-3 holes, set up with Indy car racing theme.  Nicely decorated.  As a race fan, the little details were great.  Car and engine parts all over the place.  :-)

We went on a Monday, right as they opened at noon.  We were the first group to attend and managed to get through our 15 laps and part of our mini-golf game before any others arrived.   The staff were generous with our laps, likely because it was so quiet.  The front desk staff, Monica, was lovely.  I was using a Groupon but wanted to purchase additional laps so she listened to what I was trying to get and then told me of a less expensive option that would give us the same amount of track time.  She saved me $15.00  :-)  Friendly and helpful, she really made my day.
Balaclavas were included in the cost.  Not just a hair net, but an actual fabric balaclava.

The karts were varied in performance.  They were not created equal which is fine....as long as you aren't placing any bets.  ;-)  We raced in the Junior Karts so that the three of us could all race together.
The cost was comparable with other indoor karting facilities that we've been to.
My only words of warning are:

If you have sensitivities to gas, exhaust, dust etc then be sure to bring your inhaler, allergy tablet etc.  The fumes were noticeable but not overwhelming.  I tend to be more sensitive than most.   I was having sneezing fits in the mini-golf, but it was likely due to the dust accumulation in the "carpet".  Something that my sensitive nose has come to expect in an activity like that one.

Also...dress for the weather outside.  Even though it was inside, the doors were open and the fans were on, presumably to help with clearing the exhaust from the karts, but this left the temperature in the building at around 3-4 degrees.  In my 15 laps my hands became so cold that I had to cover them with my sweater sleeves.  Bring driving gloves if it still happens to be cold outside.
We purchased 30 laps each overall and used them in two races of 15 laps each.  That, for us, was a perfect length.   Attending the activity were my Autistic 18 year old, my 12 year old, and me.
Overall a great experience.  Friendly and welcoming staff.  Pricing was as expected.  Karts were average.  The fun we had was priceless.

reviews.title: Deceptive
text: When you purchase 10 laps you are actually only purchasing 4 minutes of go kart time. We only went around the track 4 times during that time. If you factor in the delayed start you get even less than 4 minutes of actual driving.

reviews.title: Pro karts are fast! Enjoyable experience
text: I can appreciate this place is super busy in the evening and weekends. We decided to go on a Friday afternoon and it was empty. We had the place to ourselves and loved it. No traffic, had a lot of fun. Would recommend and caution going during the busy times.

reviews.title: Over 2 hour wait
text: We were here for our friends birthday and let me tell you, it's been special. Not only was there no parking, but all the tables were dirty, there's food everywhere. We were told that even though we had a reservation they didn't know who we were or what we were talking about with until the birthday boy showed up. Suddenly they knew exactly who are reservation was with... What a surprise! We then had the pleasure of waiting exactly 2 hours to go-cart when we were told one hour max. We also got to watch people who only just walked in get to go ahead of us. All the staff are supposed to be watching the cars, instead they're playing on their phones. 2 groups of kids (not ours) kept getting stuck and the parents continually had to let the staff know because the employees were either talking to each other or on their phones. And when they finally went to go help, they took their time doing it. All the negative reviews are true. DEFINITELY NOT WORTH $32. We will never come back.

reviews.title: Kids bday party
text: 401 Mini Indy Go-Karts fun place for go kars. I had my 2 boys bday party there. I did the F1 package, which is 10 laps and golfing. Boys had tons of fun. I wish they had more of double seater kars available only 3. I had few kids that could only go on doubles and took a while. It was a Sunday early afternoon place wasn't busy which it was a bonus! Staff was very helpful,  nice kids working there. The girl at the desk was very nice and knew what she was talking about.  The guys at the kars were great too. Made sure my bunch of kids were taking care of. Thanx Guys!! I recommend this place for smaller parties just because If you end up during busy hours ....it's a wait . I had just over 20 kids and it wasn't too busy. Lucky me! Place could be cleaner though around the party area. Right after the go karts kids did the glow in the dark golfing that was fun too. I definitely recommend this place. And my boys so want to go back. 🚘

reviews.title: Staff were just sitting on their phone
text: We went with a Groupon we had. Immediately upon entering we walked in to find the staff  no more than 20 years old just sitting and texting. We finally got her attention but we're given a look of death for taking attention away from texting no doubt many different guys on her phone. We got our ticket and luckily we went on a weekday so it was not busy. This was our second attempt at going , on a Saturday we were told it was a two hour wait. The go karts are fast and fun. We didn't experience to much of the bumping and recklessness that the yelp reviews talk about. They time your laps and give you a print out after which is nice. After the go karting we did the mini golf. There were several staff that came and and started putting on our hole before we were even done it. They were also yelling around. Overall we had fun, the place is rundown with exhaust fumes but we still liked it. Would recommend hiring adult instead of children and improve work ethic.

reviews.title: So much potential. So poorly executed.
text: Visited last Saturday for a friends birthday. If you've read anything I've posted in the past you know I tend to stick to the positive. This doesn't mean I don't encounter negative. I just choose to ignore it.

This place has a lot of potential but it's poorly run, dirty and possibly unsafe. Having customers wait standing out above the track is a questionable choice. The ventilation in this place cannot keep up with the exhaust fumes from the little gas burners. Our group waited for over 1.5 hours. I left with a headache and clothes that simply stink. The facility beyond the poor air quality is also dirty in general. Right from the moment you walk in you can tell you'll want to grab the hand sanitizer  as soon as you leave. Dirty.

As with other reviews, I'll concur, the staff is rude. In addition to that I question the logic behind staff not abiding by the track rules and essentially showing off racing around with the customers. Doesn't make a lot of sense. Why the staff is allowed to race without helmets is a poor choice.

There were a few other negative issues with our visit but I'm going to leave this here. As I said this place has a lot of potential but it needs help. It needs a solid cleaning from top to bottom. Toronto Public Health should also likely drop by on a Saturday when the place is cranking and take some air samples. I can't believe the exhaust fans in operation are anywhere near capable of doing the what they should be doing.
If you go to this place plan on doubling the amount of time you think it will take. Oh...and it's expensive for what you get. $33.75 for 20 laps!
Gentlemen...don your breathing apparatus!

reviews.title: B day party-terrible way to waste ur Saturday
text: Messy ,unproffesional,rude service on the race track. Looks that ppl working there have their preferences and treat some clients better than others

reviews.title: birthday party
text: my son spend his 11th bday party in this place.  Everything was good esp the staff.  customer service is excellent from the lady who helped us over the phone from that gentleman in the counter.  Very helpful.  Just beware of the pizza place they order pizza from as they only accept cash.   The only thing I can complain is the wait for the mini go kart as they only allow 10 at a time due to safety reason so it is better to be there early.   They just need to update the front as it looks very run down.  I will not go there at night.

reviews.title: They discriminate against disabled children!
text: We bought a membership and signed a waiver for my disabled 12 year old who is confined to crutches or a wheelchair. Her condition is not affected by go-carting and I explained this to the staff, who decided she "must be injured" and wouldn,t let her ride. The owner would not have a conversation with me and told me to "shut up". My kids were all in shock as was I. If anyone has a disabled child they'd feel the horrible hurt I'm feeling right now. And I feel so helpless.

reviews.title: Just having fun
text: I have to say this is one of the better go-kart places to go. The staff in my mind have always been friendly to me and the people I am with and we always have a great time.
If you, you should have a good time, its lots of fun for the young and old. Just keep in mind it is indoors and that some people are a little crazier then others, just go and enjoy yourself
